edu.rit.pj2

Class LongParallelForLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.ParallelStatement
      • edu.rit.pj2.ParallelForLoop
        • edu.rit.pj2.LongParallelForLoop

  • public class LongParallelForLoop
extends ParallelForLoop
    Class LongParallelForLoop provides a work sharing parallel for loop executed by multiple threads, with a loop index of type long. A long integer parallel for loop is constructed by the parallelFor(long,long) method of class Task.

    Programming pattern. To execute a parallel for loop in the main() method of a Task, follow this pattern: 

     public class MyTask extends Task
     {
     public void main (String[] args)
         {
         parallelFor (lb, ub) .exec (new LongLoop()
             {
             // Thread-local variable declarations (optional)
             public void start()
                 {
                 // One-time thread-local initialization (optional method)
                 }
             public void run (long i)
                 {
                 // Loop body code for iteration i (required method)
                 }
             public void finish()
                 {
                 // One-time thread-local finalization (optional method)
                 }
             });
         }
     }

    Loop index bounds. lb is the lower bound of the loop index (inclusive). ub is the upper bound of the loop index (inclusive). These are both of type long. (For a parallel for loop with a loop index of type int, see class IntParallelForLoop.) If lb > ub, it represents a loop with no iterations. If lb ≤ ub, it represents a loop with one or more iterations.

    Parallel thread team. The parallel for loop is executed by a team of threads. The number of threads is given by the threads property of the enclosing task (see the threads() method of class Task). The default is one thread for each core of the machine on which the program is running. The default can be overridden as follows: 

         parallelFor (lb, ub) .threads (threads) .exec (new LongLoop() ...

    Parallel loop schedule. The parallel for loop's iterations are partitioned among the threads as specified by the schedule and chunk properties of the enclosing task (see the schedule() and chunk() methods of class Task). The default is a fixed schedule. The default schedule can be overridden as follows: 

         parallelFor (lb, ub) .schedule (schedule) .exec (new LongLoop() ...

    Both the default schedule and the default chunk size can be overridden as follows: 

         parallelFor (lb, ub) .schedule (schedule) .chunk (chunk) .exec (new LongLoop() ...

    Parallel loop body. The threads execute the methods in the inner LongLoop class. For further information about how the parallel for loop executes, see class LongLoop.

    See Also:
    ParallelStatement, ParallelForLoop, LongLoop

    • Method Detail

      • threads

        public LongParallelForLoop threads(int threads)
        Set this parallel for loop's threads property. The threads property specifies the number of threads that will execute this parallel for loop. The default is the threads property of the enclosing task. For further information, see the threads() method of class Task.
        Parameters:
        threads - Number of threads (≥ 1), Task.THREADS_EQUALS_CORES, or Task.DEFAULT_THREADS.
        Returns:
        This parallel for loop object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if threads is illegal.

      • schedule

        public LongParallelForLoop schedule(Schedule schedule)
        Set this parallel for loop's schedule property. The schedule property, along with the chunk property, specifies how the iterations of this parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing this parallel for loop. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules. The default is the schedule property of the enclosing task. For further information, see the schedule() method of class Task.
        Parameters:
        schedule - Parallel for loop schedule, or Task.DEFAULT_SCHEDULE.
        Returns:
        This parallel for loop object.
        See Also:
        chunk(int)

      • chunk

        public LongParallelForLoop chunk(int chunk)
        Set this parallel for loop's chunk property. The chunk property, along with the schedule property, specifies how the iterations of this parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing this parallel for loop. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules. The default is the chunk property of the enclosing task. For further information, see the chunk() method of class Task.
        Parameters:
        chunk - Chunk size (≥ 1), Task.STANDARD_CHUNK, or Task.DEFAULT_CHUNK.
        Returns:
        This parallel for loop object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if chunk is illegal.
        See Also:
        schedule(Schedule)

      • exec

        public void exec(LongLoop loop)
        Execute this parallel for loop with the loop body specified by the given Loop object.
        Parameters:
        loop - Loop object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if loop is null.
